Who We Are

Cint is a global software leader in technology-enabled insights. The Cint platform automates the insights gathering process so that companies can gain access to insights faster with unparalleled scale. Cint has the one of the world’s largest consumer networks for digital survey-based research, made up of over 160 million engaged respondents across more than 130 countries. Over 3,200 insights-driven companies use Cint to accelerate how they gather consumer insights and supercharge business growth.

The Opportunity
As a Data Scientist you will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

The Team
Platform Intelligence will be part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our artificial intelligence algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance.
These insights will be used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

What You Will Do

Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics With Cint’s Product Manager and technologists, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

What We Are Looking For
A few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Master’s degree or better with formal statistical training
You have excellent communication skills to be able to explain and defend analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience designing and delivering complex programs with multiple stakeholders
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python.
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Data driven with the ability to translate abstract requests to tangible initiatives
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to navigate complex discussions and pathways ‘up and across’ the organization
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details

Bonus Points If You Have

Previous experience with online market research methods/products is a plus

Our Values
We are accountable - We do what we say, and say what we do. We believe in transparency. We drive results.
We work together - We listen to understand. We collaborate to find the best solutions. We help each other to succeed.
We drive new ideas forward - We are passionate about innovation. We are curious learners. We take smart risks.
We think beyond ourselves - We are respectful and compassionate. We champion diversity and equality. We promote a sense of belonging.

More About Cint
In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.
Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

About Fable Data

Data is one of the most valuable resources to modern businesses. A source of competitive advantage for many of the world’s most successful organisations. Powering innovation, enriching people’s lives, underpinning decisions around multi-billion-pound investments and helping to create completely new industries, power new technologies and advance our understanding of our world.

Our world is that data.

Fable Data is the leading source of real-time European consumer transaction data, using anonymised transaction data from European banks and credit card providers. Fable Data has pioneered this model within Europe and supplies data to some of the world’s largest hedge funds, the Financial Times, major government bodies, and Fortune 500 companies.
Our potential is huge, powered by an unrivalled amount of data with very low latency. This helps businesses make faster, better and more informed decisions, well ahead of other solutions in the market.

We are on a mission to provide better data to decision-makers in business and government – anonymised, real-time and at scale.

We are looking for the very best talent to join our world-class team on our journey to Unicorn status. We are well-funded and have huge aspirations to become THE leading Global provider of transaction data across both Corporate and Investor Markets. We work in an agile, proactive way, so we move fast and stay ahead of the curve. We want people to buy into our ethos that better Data in the hands of decision-makers will lead to a better world.

This role will define your career as we expect you to grow your skills and experience with us, supported by a talented team. In return, we reward our team members with:

30 days holidays + bank holidays (pro-rata)
Generous Option Scheme for every employee (HMRC-approved EMI Options)
Outstanding life/work balance
Free subscription to Financial Times
Flexible working
A wonderful team and a fun place to work
More benefits to come as we grow

Here at Fable, we are proud of our culture. Being responsible, taking ownership and aiming for excellence are the values that define us. We believe in:

People with purpose
Whole world thinking
Individual value, collective strength

Visit our “Join Us” section on our website to see how we expand on these core values and find out more about us.

From our CEO, Luke Kennedy:
“During my time in government and business, I helped Ministers, industry leaders and global investors make strategic decisions. Too often, these decisions were based on data sets that are small in sample, stale and skewed. This leads to sub-optimal decisions on matters of policy, capital allocation and commercial strategies – ultimately negatively impacting economic growth, job creation and levels of investment into public services. I was frustrated and at times very worried and believed there must be better data out there. This is why I set up Fable Data. We are working with technology and financial partners from across Europe to build anonymous consumer data sets that are real-time, large-scale, accurate and predictive. We can see the economy in real-time. There are many commercial applications for this data, but my personal mission is to get this data into the hands of decision-makers everywhere, as better data will lead to better decisions, and I believe, a better world.”

The Interview Process

Pre-screening call – online (30 mins.), to assess initial interest and suitability by the Talent Acquisition Manager/People Director
Technical Test – brief homework, serves the purpose of you seeing what work you would be doing and, us assessing your technical expertise/knowledge
Technical Interview – online/in the office (1 hour), to talk through your solutions with the team
Final Stage Interview - online/in the office (1 hour), competency-based and behavioural questions to assess overall role fit and cultural fit
Decision
Offer of Employment issued
“Get to know us” meetings/calls with other members of Fable Data, for you to learn more about the role, company and future colleagues while considering the offer

Please note that applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Fable Data is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability, or sexual orientation. All candidates will be assessed based on merit, qualifications, and their ability to perform the role requirements.

About Brave Bison

Brave Bison is a different beast: a media, marketing and technology company built for the new era.

Our universe is made up of award-winning business arms including Brave Bison Performance, Brave Bison Commerce and Brave Bison Social & Influencer. And we’re underpinned by a universe like no other – our very own social-first media network. We connect digital experiences, creators and conversions and get monthly views in the billions. We know how to make hearts roar.


The digital world is our natural environment. We feel at home in its ever-changing landscape. We draw on rich experience and we know what’s coming next. With hubs all over the globe, we work with some of the boldest brands in the world, helping them to cut through the chaos and navigate a fragmented digital ecosystem.

And we don't believe location should limit you. Three continents. One herd. Whether you work in the office, remote, or a mix of both. We’re a global collective that live and breathe digital.

Brave Bison Performance

With a rich heritage in data science and proving ROI – we're the proud Performance arm of the Brave Bison. From paid media to SEO to DPR and everything in-between, we skill-share and work together to test the boundaries of what’s possible. We love what we do.

With an impressive roster of clients that span across a whole range of industries, from retail to technology, including the likes of: New Balance, Currys, Hiscox and GHD. We truly get to the heart of our clients’ businesses to unlock incremental growth. We're unstacked and don't believe one size fits all.

We’re award winning for a reason. We know that to create epic campaigns in a world this complex you can’t stick to what you know or what you’ve done. Last year we grew our clients’ business by an impressive £10 billion, beating industry standard results across the board.

We’re curious and don’t play it safe. Keeping ourselves accountable we test creative approaches to campaigns by partnering with the best tech out there and when it doesn’t do exactly what we want we build our own. Together we’ll try new ideas, track everything and optimise everywhere.


Step into a universe like no other.

Job Specification

We’re seeking a freelance data scientist to consult and advise our in-house data team of data engineers, analysts and software developers. Initially we need data science support on a specific project that runs over the next 3 months, but we will have need of more support in the future and hope to find someone we can call on again.

Brave Bison builds and manages the strategy, delivery and reporting of multiple digital marketing channels for major website such as Currys, New Balance and Furniture Village. As part of this, we collect, process and interpret a vast quantity of data ranging from Google rankings to online product sales data. In general terms, we need data scientists to help us when it comes to advanced interpretation of this data and using it for automation.

2 specific projects we’re recruiting for right now requires data science input into these areas:

OneSearch Project

The assessment of dozens of data points to automatically suggest when Branded PPC ads can be turned off - on the basis that the sales that would have been generated from the ads will anyway be gained from organic Google rankings (SEO) – and turned back on again should the data suggest those sales are subsequently at risk.
Once implemented, measuring the outcome of those suggestions in a way that captures the complexity of multi-channel digital marketing with an appropriate attribution model.
Using the measurement outcome in a feedback loop that can change what actions the system suggests.
We have no fixed idea about how to approach these steps, so you will have a free hand in designing how we accomplish the desired outcomes.

Data Driven Attribution and Measurement Project

Somewhat related to measuring impact of ‘removal’ effect above in OneSearch we’re looking to build a data driven attribution model for one our key clients to help them inform and justify investment in awareness channels
Channel path data is being centralised in a CDP which becomes the one-stop view of multiple channel interactions which the model will base its estimation off
Unlike how other off-the-shelf attribution modelling providers suggest the impact of first touch channels over last touch channels; we want to be able to accurately recommend budget levels at tactic (prospecting/retargeting/KWs), channel (PPC, Display, Social) and Product Levels (SKU1, SKU2 etc…)
Furthermore, we would like to predict the point of diminishing returns for specific channel or tactic or product

We’ve previously built some internal apps for this through R and already have the complex calculations in place alongside the model adopted. You’re more than welcome to build on this or suggest a route that would allow us to get an effective and scalable solution rolled out efficiently.

Our teams will implement your design and we want you to be on hand throughout the implementation, testing and launch phases and to conduct regular check ins to ensure your design has been implemented and is working as intended.

You will report to and work primarily with the Head of Data, and also work with data engineers from the Data team and the heads of our SEO, PPC and Display teams. The other main stakeholder will be the Head of Special Projects – a function that oversees the development of innovative new tools, processes, and products in the business.

Desired behaviour’s & traits:

Enthusiastic, committed, and proactive
Methodical, analytical and accurate, with great attention to detail
Willing to speak out when something isn’t right, while showing respect for others’ points of view
Own and take pride in your work
Communicates clearly and concisely in writing and in person

Skills & experience we’re looking for:

Working with, interpreting, and using data for digital marketing attribution and measurement
Experience in projects involving various models for marketing mix modelling (provide insights into the cause and effect of digital marketing investments) and data driven attribution (accurately attribute credit for multiple channels to inform optimal budgeting decisions).
Experience in projects involving Markov’s Chain, Shapely Values, CLV/LTV models and models accuracy
Machine learning
Python
Setting up, administering, and maintaining cloud servers and databases (particularly AWS and Google Cloud)
Troubleshooting applications and codebases to quickly identify and resolve issues
Experience working in a project environment, including requirements gathering with business users and testing and deployment cycles.

What you’ll get

Our people make us who we are, so to make sure we attract and retain the best and brightest in the industry, we offer an attractive benefits package. Of course, we offer the usual perks you would expect from a leading agency (stylish office, tick! Pool table, tick! Friday beers, tick! Daily breakfast and fruit, tick!).

But not only that, we are the UK’s first carbon neutral agency (a status we have held since 2018), with a serious commitment to monitoring and reducing the impact our work has on the planet across three core sustainability pillars of Greenhouse Gases, Waste & Recycling and Sustainable Consumption.

Then there’s a whole host of benefits – from discounted gym memberships and free eye tests to an employee pension scheme and enhanced maternity, paternity, and adoption package. Here’s a snapshot of just some of the benefits we think you might also like:

Dynamic working: To keep that work-life harmony in check, we're flexible on where and when you work

Are you eager to create the best possible data science solutions that help solve customer (e.g. researchers, authors, editors) problems?
Do you want to develop decision support tools to help making faster and better decisions?
About our Team
This is an exciting opportunity for a data scientist to join a highly collaborative product data science team that works within the Elsevier Academic & Governments product group. The team helps to make the most out of Elsevier’s high-quality scientific content, data, and customer understanding. Embedded in the product teams we solve customer problems by creating recommendations and we help make faster and better decisions.
About the Role
As a Data Scientist III you should understand the best practices and processes and be able to execute them independently, and review results with supervisors. Individuals in this role should work with leads to define project scope, and then execute the necessary methods to develop, test and deliver outcomes.
Though the role will be based in London or Amsterdam, you will be working with colleagues in locations in the US and rest of Europe.
Responsibilities
You will be accountable, together with the rest of the team, for understanding product objectives, key results, and data science specific requirements.
You will develop, with senior guidance, algorithms and machine learning techniques and apply them to a wide variety of tasks such as NLP solutions and recommender systems. You will do so primarily by providing support to more senior Data Scientists who in return will provide you mentoring and development support. You will pull and clean data, and build and maintain existing models.
Requirements
Essential
Demonstrate competency of machine learning fundamentals, including model training, testing, and validation.
Able to execute standard coding languages (e.g. Python / scikit-learn, Spark / Spark-sql, Kedro, MLFlow).

Company Summary
Product Madness is a Global Powerhouse where the greatest mobile games and experiences are crafted by world-class talent. A top-grossing leader in free to play mobile games, we have more than 800 team members working across seven global talent hubs including London (headquarters), USA, Canada, Spain, Poland and Ukraine. With remarkable hit games including Heart of Vegas, Cashman Casino, Lighting Link and Big Fish Casino, we boast more than 50 million active users and 400 million downloads and counting.

We are Mad about games and the way they bring people together, and that passion and culture is what brings us together as a studio, connects us with our partners we collaborate with, and is what links us to our sister studios across the world.

Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital game’s division of Pixel United.
Job Posting Title
Data Scientist
Summary
We are expanding our games data science team and are looking to add a couple of data scientists ideally junior to mid level to our already team of 20.
Your role will focus around turning business questions into actionable insights to improve our mobile games. You will be working on mobile games that are played by millions around the world.
What You'll Do
You will work with large and complex data sets and have the autonomy to make huge impact on the success of our games. You will research and analyze player behaviour, and come up with recommendations. You will do this by listening to stakeholders, understanding context and challenging business ideas. You will use diverse techniques - frequentist and Bayesian statistics, machine learning, exploratory and explanatory data analysis, causal inference, data visualization, monte carlo modelling and econometric analysis.
Responsibilities:
Discuss with stakeholders requirements for analysis
Run exploratory data analysis and turn it into questions which can be answered with analytical techniques
Use simple analytics, statistical or causal inference, machine learning or any other techniques to answer questions and tackle problems
Communicate results clearly and effectively
Why come work for Product Madness?
As well as having the opportunity to work on exciting projects in the mobile gaming space and develop as a Data Scientist we are also a people first organisation and give us some outstanding benefits that include:
Yearly Bonus
Excellent salary
Amazing Pension Scheme (up to 10% matched)
25 Days Annual leave + Christmas Closure (4 days) + Birthday off + Special occasion day off + Wellness days + Bank holidays
Hybrid working arrangements to suit you
£250 Work from home allowance to set up your home office
Private Medical + Dental Insurance
£50 a month wellness budget spend it toward your gym or massage for example
£40 a month Uber Eats Voucher
£10 a month coffee voucher
Access to Perkbox
Study Assistant programme & Counselling services
Enhanced Parental Leave
What We're Looking For
You will ideally need to bring with you the following skills/experience. Please however don't worry if you do not tick every box. we would still love to hear from you. As you will be provided with an abundance of learning and career growth opportunities.
A degree or equivalent work experience in data driven field
Experience of using visualization techniques for presenting data and analysis
Experience of using any of the following to answer business or scientific questions - statistics, mathematics, machine learning, econometrics, causal techniques, monte carlo modelling, etc.
Experience of using at least one programming language (R or Python)
Experience of using SQL
Why Product Madness?
Product Madness is so much more than just a Pool table and a foosball game.
We believe in an honest and transparent approach with our teammates. Company wide weekly Town Halls, All Hands and strategy meetings are just a few ways in which we encourage an open and honest path to achieving complete transparency.
Despite a pandemic, there isn’t a day where we don’t feel connected to one another.
With frequent events, workshops, giveaways, slack coffee and donut sessions we have definitely brought on our office culture to this new virtual world of zoom calls.
We also try to cater for all our staff’s needs – be that a freshly brewed cappuccino made by our professional barista in our free coffee shop or by providing a bountiful supply of tasty snacks to keep us refueled and buzzing.
We love to organise plenty of social get-togethers and action-packed activity days, be it slipping inside an inflatable bumper ball for a mad session of football zorbing or throwing caution to the wind and traversing giddy treetop rope courses at Go Ape. On top of these team-building activities, our lunch and learn workshops, not to mention the lavish Christmas and summer parties, foster that ‘work hard, play hard’ mantra. Our offices are based in the heart of the metropolises of London and Lviv, surrounded by an abundance of diversity and inspiration to keep those ideas flowing.
Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together
We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.
Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Job title: Data & AI graduate programme| Newcastle, London| October 2023
Description:
Data & AI Graduate VelocITy programme

Start date: 2nd October 2023

Hello, we are Avanade and we’re one of the world’s leading IT consultancies. Owned by Accenture and Microsoft, our 65,000 people globally strive to make a genuine human impact and are transforming businesses for the digital era.

With our community of extremely talented technologists and consultants, today we are the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud services, business solutions and design-led experiences on the Microsoft ecosystem. Our enthusiasm for each other and our work has and continues to take us far. Avanade has 32,000 Microsoft certifications and we’ve been named Microsoft Alliance SI Partner of the Year 17 times.

Together we’re making a difference

Greater than our credentials is our impact on the world around us. We’re working with an energy company to repopulate coral reefs, and we developed an AI chatbot to provide instant answers to tax questions for a leading engineering company. And, in the early days of COVID-19, a group of employees created an app that helped track ventilators across stretched healthcare systems.

Data & AI are on the look out

Avanade’s Data & AI team are looking for ambitious graduates to join an accelerated training programme and to bring their technical passion and skills into our Graduate VelocITy Data programme in October 2023.

As part of this programme graduates can expect 3 months of intensive training run in partnership with a market leading Data & AI training provider. Your training is followed up by a mentored introduction into client-facing project work.

Our VelocITy Data & AI Training

Technical Training: Avanade have partnered with an external training provider to provide a bespoke training programme. This is us investing in you to provide 3 months of core training led by professionals. We will of course be on the scene too- you will also get lots of time to check in with your Avanade Career Advisors, buddies and Subject Matter Experts- these people will help give you the Avanade spin on all of your learning so each day helps you develop towards your career goals.
Communications training: will help develop the consultancy skills you need to grow as a professional, consultant and when you are ready, a leader.
Developing your career through industry qualifications: during your first 6 months, your performance will be reviewed through group work and hackathons. You can also expect to complete 3 Microsoft Azure certifications within the first 12 months of your role bringing you quickly up to a certified professional level.
Career Advisors: Every Avanade employee is assigned a Career Advisor (who you will meet weekly) and a buddy to support throughout your career at Avanade.
Avanade Early Talent: As a member of one of our graduate programme, you will be part of a wider early talent community in our Avanade Early Talent. The AET directly supports junior people across the company ensuring high quality and sustained training, career mentoring, support, and engagement.
Progressing your career: Upon completing the 3-month VelocITy training, you will move into live project environments, enabling you to use your new skills as a fully-fledged consultant! And don’t panic, your Career Advisor will be on hand to help ensure a smooth transition as you take your first steps!
See bottom of page for more information about the Data & AI team.

What’s on offer?

We offer a competitive salaries £35,000 London, £30,000 out of London salary complemented by an extensive benefits package which a includes £2,000 sign on bonus and discretionary company bonus.

You work hard, so we work hard. We provide you with what you need to do and be your best. Flexible work arrangements are becoming more common so people can do good work while having a good life.

Extended benefits allowance - treat yourself!
Private BUPA healthcare and dental cover
Gym and spa membership discounts
Cycle to Work Scheme
Employee Share Purchase Plan (after 6-months)
Pension scheme contributions
Unlimited volunteering time (and many opportunities to volunteer!)
80+ hours of technical training and development courses per year
Electric Car Allowance (Senior Analyst Level and above)
25 days holiday
30 days holiday after 3 years of service
Flexible bank holidays
Who are you?

Degree: Any enabling demonstration and development of applicable role skills. Examples including but not limited to: Computer Science | Data Science | Engineering (any) | Mathematics | Physics | Natural Sciences | Technology
This is a technical role so maybe you are looking to learn or improve in Microsoft technologies like Azure / DevOps/ O365 | Python | Cloud Technologies
Evidence of interests and passion in technology
Readiness to engage with a 3-month training course.
Ability to adapt and apply existing skills to new learning and technologies
Readiness to get involved with different work, projects and locations
An analytical mind
Strong teamwork skills
Willingness to develop excellent communications skills (your role may develop into client facing positions!)
The Application Process

Role Registration: October - December
Application should include a Word Document attachment alongside CV explaining what you think you can bring to this programme (Up to 150 words)
Phone screening call with Early Talent Recruitment Team: October - December
Invite to interview: Rolling
Application closes: December
Assessment Centre: March (Group Exercise / Interview / Case Study)
Follow up and feedback: February
Start Date: 2nd October 2023
Please be advised that regrettably we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this role.

Your eligibility to work and remain in the UK will be checked by a member of the team as part of the selection process.

Learn about Data & AI at Avanade:
Today, analytics and AI are the great equalizer, where smaller organizations can create big presence and big companies can create intimate connections. In a study conducted by Avanade on [1] AI Maturity, 97% of organizations are evaluating the work AI could do - or augment humans to do.

While many organizations dream of the potential benefits from data & AI, Avanade makes that a reality, helping them bring real business value, and enabling business transformation, using data. Our capabilities, from robotic process automation, to business analytics, predictive analytics, data visualizations, data warehousing and more, help bring unprecedented insights to life and enable rapid, high value, data driven decision making.

And importantly... what do we stand for?

Together we believe everyone counts.

We believe in diversity. Diverse teams and an inclusive environment are critical to innovation and future growth. Our mission is to create an environment where employees can do their best work.

We know that a chorus of different voices makes for a richer sound. We want you to be comfortable being who you are at work. That means being in an environment where everyone else is free to be who they are, too.

We are working hard to make the technology industry more diverse. You can help us change that with your presence and your attitude. Our Inclusion & Diversity programme is a driving force in our company culture and helps us live one of our values—We believe everyone counts. Including you.

Together we connect.

Yes, we appreciate a variety of perspectives—it adds richness to our work. And yes, we understand that there are huge upsides to connecting with people who know where you’ve been and what it’s like to be you. That is why we have a bunch of employee networks where people can come together through that avenue of shared interests, background, and experiences. Employee groups do great things to create a more diverse, understanding, celebratory workforce.

Together we become a part of something bigger

Do you want to do good work, but also work that does some good in the world? Us, too. Joining Avanade means sharing our purpose—to make a genuine human impact—and helping us become a more responsible business. With forward-looking leadership and a commitment to sustainability, we can offer you the chance to make a real—and positive—difference for our clients, your Avanade colleagues, and your community.

Life comes first

There’s more to life than work. You’ll get the opportunity not just to make a positive human impact on the world while also experiencing all it has offer. We want you to experience the joy of family dinners, the thrill of outdoor adventures, the connection of volunteering in our communities, and the importance of self-care. You can’t be who you are without a flexible culture that allows you to log on when and where you work best. Because we know your best self does your best work.

Our locations

You will be based in London, (Cannon Street), Newcastle, (Cobalt Technology Park) or Manchester (Circle Square) with expectation to be working in the office or on client site when required. Our headquarters are in Seattle, and our reach is worldwide. With 65,000 professionals and over 80 offices in 25 countries, you'll partner every day with colleagues from around the world, leveraging the latest technologies to keep you connected to your team, your client and your work.

Our business:
Avanade is made up of nearly 65,000 individuals. People who share a passion for technology, who push beyond their comfort zone and always bring an open mind and who really care about making a genuine human impact at work. We invite these people to bring their authentic, whole selves into a place that welcomes curiosity as a spark to innovation. We put them together to solve some complex challenges and bring to life possibilities for our clients around the world—companies, non-profits, and government agencies that know the future is digital and look to us to help them get there with the power of people and Microsoft technology. Together, we go beyond.

Introduction:

The Economist is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our Data Science Team. Our Data Science Team is a central source of data skills working across all commercial teams in the business. Reporting to the Head of Data Science you will be leading the application of data science across the business including predictive modelling, segmentation and A/B testing.

We believe that data science can bring us a better understanding of our customers’ needs, opportunities to improve their experience and a clearer view of what is driving our business performance. In this role you will help advance The Economist’s data science capability, bringing projects to production and cementing the role of data science in the way our business operates. You will be doing hands-on data science work with transactional and behavioural datasets in our data lake. You will be directly speaking to stakeholders across the business to understand their needs and explain your work, while collaborating with data engineers and insight analysts to deliver projects cross-functionally.

We believe data science is essential to the success of our business. This role is an opportunity to apply data science to make a real difference to The Economist’s business.
Accountabilities:
Help identify areas where data science can be applied to generate value for the business
Work with stakeholders and technical teams to propose data science projects
Execute data science projects using a range of datasets and techniques
Collaborate with other technical teams to deliver solutions as needed
Communicate the outcomes and value of your work to business stakeholders
Provide feedback and define best practices where teams are using 3rd-party tools with a statistical/machine learning component, especially in relation to A/B testing
Experience, skills and professional attributes:
Prior experience as a data scientist, ideally in a B2C business that interacts with customers through digital channels
A solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning
Ability to write code to implement statistical models and machine learning processes in Python
Experience extracting, cleaning and preparing data for data science work including good knowledge of SQL
An understanding of software development best practice for production systems
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical colleagues and practically deliver a data science solution to a business problem
A meticulous approach to all work, completed to high level of quality
The ability to work under time pressure while providing high quality output
The ability to work on your own with conviction to prioritise workload
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Are you an enthusiastic and curious individual who enjoys using data to find patterns and help solve the problems faced by businesses in innovative and imaginative ways?
Would you relish the opportunity to apply these skills across diverse industries?
The opportunity
We are looking for exceptional, energetic, hard-working and hands-on enthusiastic graduates to join our group of world class employees in Autumn 2023. If successful you will be part of this team and have the unique opportunity to work with clients from start-ups through to global market leaders. You will have a passion for technology and will use a combination of innovation, flexibility and technical excellence to meet and exceed our customers’ often demanding requirements and tight development timescales.
We have
A multitude of exciting projects in the medical, industrial and consumer sectors
Projects ranging from quick build proof-of-principle prototypes through to full solution development
The opportunity to work with clients to define their needs and to develop innovative and exciting solutions
You will have:
A degree 2.1 or above, (or even a PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical or Science-based
Experience using Python/ R – that’s what most of our work is done with
Working in at least 2 data science or machine learning projects (this could be as part of your education or in any past jobs)
Analytical and problem-solving skills
You might also have (but not essential):
Knowledge of Natural Language Processing areas such as topic modelling, sentiment analysis, chatbots & virtual assistants and speech recognition
Any PC software development experience
A day in the life
You will be a member of our Data Science & Insights team. As part of a team building innovative solutions for clients, you'll extract, analyse and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools. You will select & use existing open-source/ commercial machine learning algorithms where possible and work with our talented mathematicians to build custom data algorithms where required. You will train, test and combine algorithms into models which power innovative solutions for our clients, delivering real-world impact.
Your work will predominately be based at our Sagentia offices in Harston, Cambridge or Epsom, Surrey and there may also be opportunities to travel to client sites in Europe or USA. You will enjoy a fast-paced environment in which we solve a variety of challenges from different industries.
At any one time we have dozens of projects in the medical, industrial and consumer sectors. As an experienced data scientist, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in developing innovative machine learning/ artificial intelligence-based solutions on one or more projects simultaneously across sectors.
Career development
You will work on client projects from your first day; we think this provides you with the opportunity to learn from a fantastic team of colleagues and put your great technical skills to use immediately! We work with you from the start of your time with us to ensure we understand how you want to develop your career in the future. We have a great variety of projects taking place at all times and identify, offer and provide bespoke training to support you in developing your existing skills and fill in any gaps. When you join you will be paired with a mentor whose job is to help you settle in, inspire you and instil the Sagentia way.
Every one of our employees has the opportunity to progress and develop within our business – there is no career ceiling; with commitment and hard work there is no limit to what you can achieve! Success looks different to everyone and Sagentia provides great career advancement whether you want to apply your technical skills to brilliant projects, find solutions to problems no one else can solve, deepen and broaden your technical knowledge, manage complex projects, teams or business development!
Benefits
You will be offered a competitive salary and benefits package.

Join us! There's never been a better time to do your life's best work℠

About Turing Talent
The Turing Talent Internship Program is the first of its kind - it’s a job and a leadership program rolled into one. You not only work at some of the most cutting-edge companies, but also receive mentorship and join a high-calibre industry network. The program is designed to accelerate your trajectory in a technical career. www.turingtalent.org
About Prorizon
Prorizon is a digital health tech start-up using an integrated mind-body approach to enable optimal health and performance for today’s youth in high pressure environments. Prorizon is building the new technology needed to optimise mind and body, reducing the mental health crisis in high pressure environments, enabling young people to thrive. Prorizon’s starting point and alpha users are young athletes whose mental health is often overseen – Leading to an imbalance (Prorizon strives to bringing that balance back).
About the role
Prorizon is looking for someone who has the ability to work with large data sets and to develop and test relevant algorithms and models, someone who is passionate about working with data to develop complex solutions, this is integral to the success of their product. The data science intern will work closely with Prorizon’s Science & R&D Director and Data Science Advisor.
What you'll do
· Oversee and support the development of junior data-science ad research interns.
· Develop and run machine learning models using, e.g., Python.
· Design and deliver visual data and insights that are clear and relevant to athletes.
· Communicate and collaborate with our data science advisor to ensure data reliability.
· An ability to work independently and as part of a team.
· Work with real-time data to inform the development of our product.
· Deliver progress updates to the wider team.
· Generate ideas to improve engagement of sporting audiences with their health data.

· An independent, creative problem-solver with a can-do attitude.
· Flexibility to work in a fast-paced and fast-changing environment.
· Common sense to see when something is not working and the capability to inform next steps
· Driven by using your skills and data for good.
Desirable
· Passion for sports.
· Previous experience and evidence of machine learning projects.
· Available for up to 6 months (shorter terms will be considered).

Data Scientist

Location: London, UK (London Bridge)
Work pattern: Full-time (Hybrid or remote), permanent, PAYE
Salary: We have a number of roles open at various levels
Junior level: £35,000 – £45,000 per annum, DOE, plus generous options
Mid-level: £42,000 – £70,000 per annum, DOE, plus generous options
Senior level: £60,000 – £90,000 per annum, DOE, plus generous options
Reporting line: to Head of Data Science/Senior Data Scientist/Data Science Lead
Division: Data Science
Application Process: When submitting your application, answer each question in order to be considered for this role.

Do you want to change the world with Data? Data is our universe. Finding it. Playing with it. Working with it.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with 3+ years of experience to join our fast-growing Data and Technology team.
As a company, we harmonise anonymised consumer transaction data and create products for investment and corporate clients. We are rapidly growing with a truly innovative solution that our clients use to understand the performance of listed companies and their business sectors. Our products give real-time insight on revenue shifts, market share, consumer switching and online / store sales.

You are passionate about building scalable, secure and efficient data science products.
You feel comfortable working in a fast-paced, rapidly changing start-up environment, which will require resilience and the ability to deal with ambiguity and less developed processes / systems.

What you’re responsible for
Analyse and develop NLP models for text classification to homogenise and tag transactions
Assist in developing cloud infrastructure and data pipelines for wrapping models into API calls
Conduct exploratory data analysis for commercial, auditing and compliance teams

Your Ownership areas
Ground truthing and related code artefacts
Develop machine learning models and manage deployment
Document process and development methodology

Essential skills
Excellent knowledge of Python for data analysis (accordingly to your level)
Strong SQL skills (accordingly to your level)
Strong experience working in NLP - Unsupervised Text Classification of unstructured data
Experience in working with Timeseries analysis and predictive modelling
Strong experience building and deploying machine learning models on at least one cloud provider - Azure or AWS (accordingly to your level)
Proven experience in building models and algorithms from scratch
Data Visualisation and storytelling using Python

Desirable skills
Experience in the application of Software Engineering Principles in Data Science
Experience in Big Data technologies such as Apache Hadoop, Spark and NoSQL databases
Experience working in Financial Services

About Fable Data

Data is one of the most valuable resources to modern businesses. A source of competitive advantage for many of the world’s most successful organisations. Powering innovation, enriching people’s lives, underpinning decisions around multi-billion-pound investments and helping to create completely new industries, power new technologies and advance our understanding of our world.

Our world is that data.

Fable Data is the leading source of real-time European consumer transaction data, using anonymised transaction data from European banks and credit card providers. Fable Data has pioneered this model within Europe and supplies data to some of the world’s largest hedge funds, the Financial Times, major government bodies, and Fortune 500 companies.
Our potential is huge, powered by an unrivalled amount of data with very low latency. This helps businesses make faster, better and more informed decisions, well ahead of other solutions in the market.

We are on a mission to provide better data to decision-makers in business and government – anonymised, real-time and at scale.

We are looking for the very best talent to join our world-class team on our journey to Unicorn status. We are well-funded and have huge aspirations to become THE leading Global provider of transaction data across both Corporate and Investor Markets. We work in an agile, proactive way, so we move fast and stay ahead of the curve. We want people to buy into our ethos that better Data in the hands of decision-makers will lead to a better world.

This role will define your career as we expect you to grow your skills and experience with us, supported by a talented team. In return, we reward our team members with:

30 days holidays + bank holidays (pro-rata)
Generous Option Scheme for every employee (HMRC-approved EMI Options)
Outstanding life/work balance
Free subscription to Financial Times
Flexible working
A wonderful team and a fun place to work
More benefits to come as we grow

Here at Fable, we are proud of our culture. Being responsible, taking ownership and aiming for excellence are the values that define us. We believe in:

People with purpose
Whole world thinking
Individual value, collective strength

Visit our “Join Us” section on our website to see how we expand on these core values and find out more about us.

From our CEO, Luke Kennedy:
“During my time in government and business, I helped Ministers, industry leaders and global investors make strategic decisions. Too often, these decisions were based on data sets that are small in sample, stale and skewed. This leads to sub-optimal decisions on matters of policy, capital allocation and commercial strategies – ultimately negatively impacting economic growth, job creation and levels of investment into public services. I was frustrated and at times very worried and believed there must be better data out there. This is why I set up Fable Data. We are working with technology and financial partners from across Europe to build anonymous consumer data sets that are real-time, large-scale, accurate and predictive. We can see the economy in real-time. There are many commercial applications for this data, but my personal mission is to get this data into the hands of decision-makers everywhere, as better data will lead to better decisions, and I believe, a better world.”

The Interview Process

Pre-screening call – online (30 mins.), to assess initial interest and suitability by the Talent Acquisition Manager/People Director
Technical Test – brief homework, serves the purpose of you seeing what work you would be doing and, us assessing your technical expertise/knowledge
Technical Interview – online/in the office (1 hour), to talk through your solutions with the team
Final Stage Interview - online/in the office (1 hour), competency-based and behavioural questions to assess overall role fit and cultural fit
Decision
Offer of Employment issued
“Get to know us” meetings/calls with other members of Fable Data, for you to learn more about the role, company and future colleagues while considering the offer

Please note that applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Fable Data is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability, or sexual orientation. All candidates will be assessed based on merit, qualifications, and their ability to perform the role requirements.

About us
Machine Medicine Technologies (MMT) uses computer vision and computational statistics to enhance the neurological assessment of patients. Our first product, KELVIN, allows motor assessments in Parkinson’s disease to be performed, recorded and used both faster and better than has ever previously been possible. KELVIN-PD is already in use at clinical sites across several countries and possesses a CE mark, being a class-I medical device. MMT aims to build the platform into a generalised tool for patient selection, surgical planning and device programming for machine brain interfacing, a revolutionary therapeutic innovation.
Culture
A fast-moving startup, with an energetic and dynamic team, looking to disrupt the MedTech industry with AI. Our employees are encouraged to take on the sort of career development opportunities that cannot be found at larger, more established, companies. We are in the highly regulated medical device industry, so our engineering team has to have an even greater focus on quality, usability and versatility. We also like to blow off steam, whether that’s playing a few rounds of table tennis in the office, or arranging an online gaming session.
Company Benefits
Competitive salary
Employee equity programme
Pension
25 days annual leave (+UK bank holidays)
Offices close to London Bridge, Bermondsey Street and Borough Market
About you
You are an ambitious and capable data scientist with a background in computational statistics and machine learning, with multiple years of industry experience. You have put relevant statistical and machine learning techniques into practice in production settings, understanding the pitfalls encountered with optimising data pipelines and applications. Previous work in a biomedical sector would be beneficial but not mandatory. You care about impact and want to do work that matters.
List of main duties and responsibilities:
Applying statistical and ML techniques to interesting problems.
Authoring academic papers and contributing to our research strategy.
Deploying and managing code in a production environment.
Keeping up to date with relevant research.
Skills
Strong coding skills in Python, and experience with commonly used data science libraries (sklearn, pandas, numpy).
Strong understanding of statistical and ML techniques (experience with Computer Vision would be beneficial).
Experience deploying/scaling ML pipelines in a production environment, and/or academic publication authorship record.
Good communication and data visualization skills.
Familiar with git, bash and coding best practices.
Familiarity with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, Batch) would be beneficial.
Experience with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, Fastai) is beneficial but not necessary.
Experience
3+ years industry experience (or 1+ years and a PhD).
Qualifications
BSc & MSc (at least one of these should be in statistics or data science).
PhD preferable.

Function:
Business Intelligence and Data Science
Closing Date:
27/01/2023
Virgin Media are on a mission to become the most recommended brand by our customers. The combination of 02 and VM have 46 million of them, so this is a big opportunity We have At the heart of this strategy is investing in data science and machine learning initiatives.
This role is a hands-on role working across multiple programs of working including personalisation, operations and network data science capabilities. You’ll be building ML models and writing code in real time services powering the virgin media digital products (website and apps), our marketing capabilities, network efficiency and ensuring our operations are running optimally. You’ll be part of a larger team of data scientists, and as a principal will be working to set direction and accelerate the most critical projects.
A normal week might look like reviewing prediction models, digging into data to look for opportunities, writing code for production services, doing code reviews for junior members, working with an established data engineering / ML Ops team to determine platform choices for data scientists to be most efficient and effective. You’ll work with stakeholders to determine how data science can optimize their processes, and then work with the wider team to bring those solutions to fruition.
We’re primarily a Google and Python shop. It’s fine if your background is in Azure, AWS or another cloud technology provider. Experience in cloud technologies in some manner is expected, as you’ll be expected to give guidance to more junior members of the team on optimal methods for interacting with these. You’ll work with other principals to be evaluating the current state of technologies to choose new ones as well, but primarily we build in house.
Apply for this job if you are a senior data scientist or ML engineer working on production ML backed services and looking to take the next step in your career. You’ll join a great team of product managers, software and ML engineers, data analysts and analyst engineers and data scientists!
The must haves:
Experience applying knowledge in statistics and machine learning to real world commercial problems
Experience bringing live services using machine learning and python to production.
Expert knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, Scikit-learn, tensorflow, etc…) knowledge in other programming languages is valuable, but this is a Python shop. (R, Matlab…)
Experience with things like CI/CD pipelines, Docker or similar, cloud hosting, good software engineering practices – we have an ML Ops team but as a principal you need to be familiar with why these things are good and how to use/do them
Experience working in an agile software development environment
Strong mathematics or statistics background gained through MSc/PhD education in scientific field / computer science
Ability to translate consumer business problems into data science use cases and requirements
Other stuff we're looking for:
Good interpersonal skills offering ability to explain complex techniques to non-technical audience
Focus on implementation and business impact of modelling through commercial acuity
Proactive and creative while considering approaches to use data to solve problems.
Advanced data preparation and munging skills with ability to transform data into suitable formats and outputs.
Ability to visualise and communicate findings in an understandable manner to non-technical users
What's in it for you?
We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.
All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.
If you go on to be successful in your application, some of the many benefits include:
25 days' annual leave, plus UK bank holidays
Annual bonus paid up to 15% of your annual salary
A defined contribution pension scheme, run by Fidelity, matched up to 10%
Access to wellbeing benefits such as the Unmind App, personal medical cover (which you can opt to upgrade to cover loved ones) and critical illness cover
Season ticket loans
Your birthday off every year, to treat yourself
The option to buy and sell up to 5 days leave, to suit your personal needs
Next steps

If you think you've got some amazing skills to offer us, and Virgin Media feels like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two-stage interview process including technical and competency assessments.
When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.
Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media family.Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you

Job title: Data & AI graduate programme| Newcastle, London| October 2023
Description:
Data & AI Graduate VelocITy programme

Start date: 2nd October 2023

Hello, we are Avanade and we’re one of the world’s leading IT consultancies. Owned by Accenture and Microsoft, our 65,000 people globally strive to make a genuine human impact and are transforming businesses for the digital era.

With our community of extremely talented technologists and consultants, today we are the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud services, business solutions and design-led experiences on the Microsoft ecosystem. Our enthusiasm for each other and our work has and continues to take us far. Avanade has 32,000 Microsoft certifications and we’ve been named Microsoft Alliance SI Partner of the Year 17 times.

Together we’re making a difference

Greater than our credentials is our impact on the world around us. We’re working with an energy company to repopulate coral reefs, and we developed an AI chatbot to provide instant answers to tax questions for a leading engineering company. And, in the early days of COVID-19, a group of employees created an app that helped track ventilators across stretched healthcare systems.

Data & AI are on the look out

Avanade’s Data & AI team are looking for ambitious graduates to join an accelerated training programme and to bring their technical passion and skills into our Graduate VelocITy Data programme in October 2023.

As part of this programme graduates can expect 3 months of intensive training run in partnership with a market leading Data & AI training provider. Your training is followed up by a mentored introduction into client-facing project work.

Our VelocITy Data & AI Training

Technical Training: Avanade have partnered with an external training provider to provide a bespoke training programme. This is us investing in you to provide 3 months of core training led by professionals. We will of course be on the scene too- you will also get lots of time to check in with your Avanade Career Advisors, buddies and Subject Matter Experts- these people will help give you the Avanade spin on all of your learning so each day helps you develop towards your career goals.
Communications training: will help develop the consultancy skills you need to grow as a professional, consultant and when you are ready, a leader.
Developing your career through industry qualifications: during your first 6 months, your performance will be reviewed through group work and hackathons. You can also expect to complete 3 Microsoft Azure certifications within the first 12 months of your role bringing you quickly up to a certified professional level.
Career Advisors: Every Avanade employee is assigned a Career Advisor (who you will meet weekly) and a buddy to support throughout your career at Avanade.
Avanade Early Talent: As a member of one of our graduate programme, you will be part of a wider early talent community in our Avanade Early Talent. The AET directly supports junior people across the company ensuring high quality and sustained training, career mentoring, support, and engagement.
Progressing your career: Upon completing the 3-month VelocITy training, you will move into live project environments, enabling you to use your new skills as a fully-fledged consultant! And don’t panic, your Career Advisor will be on hand to help ensure a smooth transition as you take your first steps!
See bottom of page for more information about the Data & AI team.

What’s on offer?

We offer a competitive salaries £35,000 London, £30,000 out of London salary complemented by an extensive benefits package which a includes £2,000 sign on bonus and discretionary company bonus.

You work hard, so we work hard. We provide you with what you need to do and be your best. Flexible work arrangements are becoming more common so people can do good work while having a good life.

Extended benefits allowance - treat yourself!
Private BUPA healthcare and dental cover
Gym and spa membership discounts
Cycle to Work Scheme
Employee Share Purchase Plan (after 6-months)
Pension scheme contributions
Unlimited volunteering time (and many opportunities to volunteer!)
80+ hours of technical training and development courses per year
Electric Car Allowance (Senior Analyst Level and above)
25 days holiday
30 days holiday after 3 years of service
Flexible bank holidays
Who are you?

Degree: Any enabling demonstration and development of applicable role skills. Examples including but not limited to: Computer Science | Data Science | Engineering (any) | Mathematics | Physics | Natural Sciences | Technology
This is a technical role so maybe you are looking to learn or improve in Microsoft technologies like Azure / DevOps/ O365 | Python | Cloud Technologies
Evidence of interests and passion in technology
Readiness to engage with a 3-month training course.
Ability to adapt and apply existing skills to new learning and technologies
Readiness to get involved with different work, projects and locations
An analytical mind
Strong teamwork skills
Willingness to develop excellent communications skills (your role may develop into client facing positions!)
The Application Process

Role Registration: October - December
Application should include a Word Document attachment alongside CV explaining what you think you can bring to this programme (Up to 150 words)
Phone screening call with Early Talent Recruitment Team: October - December
Invite to interview: Rolling
Application closes: December
Assessment Centre: March (Group Exercise / Interview / Case Study)
Follow up and feedback: February
Start Date: 2nd October 2023
Please be advised that regrettably we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this role.

Your eligibility to work and remain in the UK will be checked by a member of the team as part of the selection process.

Learn about Data & AI at Avanade:
Today, analytics and AI are the great equalizer, where smaller organizations can create big presence and big companies can create intimate connections. In a study conducted by Avanade on [1] AI Maturity, 97% of organizations are evaluating the work AI could do - or augment humans to do.

While many organizations dream of the potential benefits from data & AI, Avanade makes that a reality, helping them bring real business value, and enabling business transformation, using data. Our capabilities, from robotic process automation, to business analytics, predictive analytics, data visualizations, data warehousing and more, help bring unprecedented insights to life and enable rapid, high value, data driven decision making.

And importantly... what do we stand for?

Together we believe everyone counts.

We believe in diversity. Diverse teams and an inclusive environment are critical to innovation and future growth. Our mission is to create an environment where employees can do their best work.

We know that a chorus of different voices makes for a richer sound. We want you to be comfortable being who you are at work. That means being in an environment where everyone else is free to be who they are, too.

We are working hard to make the technology industry more diverse. You can help us change that with your presence and your attitude. Our Inclusion & Diversity programme is a driving force in our company culture and helps us live one of our values—We believe everyone counts. Including you.

Together we connect.

Yes, we appreciate a variety of perspectives—it adds richness to our work. And yes, we understand that there are huge upsides to connecting with people who know where you’ve been and what it’s like to be you. That is why we have a bunch of employee networks where people can come together through that avenue of shared interests, background, and experiences. Employee groups do great things to create a more diverse, understanding, celebratory workforce.

Together we become a part of something bigger

Do you want to do good work, but also work that does some good in the world? Us, too. Joining Avanade means sharing our purpose—to make a genuine human impact—and helping us become a more responsible business. With forward-looking leadership and a commitment to sustainability, we can offer you the chance to make a real—and positive—difference for our clients, your Avanade colleagues, and your community.

Life comes first

There’s more to life than work. You’ll get the opportunity not just to make a positive human impact on the world while also experiencing all it has offer. We want you to experience the joy of family dinners, the thrill of outdoor adventures, the connection of volunteering in our communities, and the importance of self-care. You can’t be who you are without a flexible culture that allows you to log on when and where you work best. Because we know your best self does your best work.

Our locations

You will be based in London, (Cannon Street), Newcastle, (Cobalt Technology Park) or Manchester (Circle Square) with expectation to be working in the office or on client site when required. Our headquarters are in Seattle, and our reach is worldwide. Introduction:

The Economist is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our Data Science Team. Our Data Science Team is a central source of data skills working across all commercial teams in the business. Reporting to the Head of Data Science you will be leading the application of data science across the business including predictive modelling, segmentation and A/B testing.

We believe that data science can bring us a better understanding of our customers’ needs, opportunities to improve their experience and a clearer view of what is driving our business performance. In this role you will help advance The Economist’s data science capability, bringing projects to production and cementing the role of data science in the way our business operates. You will be doing hands-on data science work with transactional and behavioural datasets in our data lake. You will be directly speaking to stakeholders across the business to understand their needs and explain your work, while collaborating with data engineers and insight analysts to deliver projects cross-functionally.

We believe data science is essential to the success of our business. This role is an opportunity to apply data science to make a real difference to The Economist’s business.
Accountabilities:
Help identify areas where data science can be applied to generate value for the business
Work with stakeholders and technical teams to propose data science projects
Execute data science projects using a range of datasets and techniques
Collaborate with other technical teams to deliver solutions as needed
Communicate the outcomes and value of your work to business stakeholders
Provide feedback and define best practices where teams are using 3rd-party tools with a statistical/machine learning component, especially in relation to A/B testing
Experience, skills and professional attributes:
Prior experience as a data scientist, ideally in a B2C business that interacts with customers through digital channels
A solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning
Ability to write code to implement statistical models and machine learning processes in Python
Experience extracting, cleaning and preparing data for data science work including good knowledge of SQL
An understanding of software development best practice for production systems
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical colleagues and practically deliver a data science solution to a business problem
A meticulous approach to all work, completed to high level of quality
The ability to work under time pressure while providing high quality output
The ability to work on your own with conviction to prioritise workload
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Atkins Building Design practice are committed to delivering project solutions in any sphere of the built environment that demonstrably improve the quality of life for those people who live, work and play within them. We do this using positive and pioneering technology and exploiting applied research and innovation, with data being the backbone to everything we develop. In support of this we have a dedicated multi-disciplinary research & innovation team, introducing a range of complementary skills to the more traditional design and engineering professionals. Through SNC-Lavalin’s significant industry position, we are involved in some of the world’s largest and most important building projects and this team is central to ensuring our designers deliver leading-edge solutions.
We are currently looking for a data scientist to work alongside our existing data science team working across a broad area of data analytics related to the built environment. This role will provide the opportunity to be directly involved in the delivery of a global giga project and explore new ways that data science can inform and improve the construction industry. The ideal candidate for this role would be someone who 3-5 years’ professional experience post-graduate working in an applied data analytics role within a commercial environment. Knowledge of the built environment sector and how new technology and data driven frameworks can create better places for people is preferable.
Full-time. London based (flexible).
Responsibilities:
Work alongside the Head of Research & Innovation to develop practical and applicable data led solutions in response to innovation challenges.
Lead the scoping, design and delivery of data science outputs and projects for live built environment projects.
Prototype solutions, rapidly testing new ideas, debugging, and refactoring existing models.
Setting the data structure and building databases where relevant or supporting others to build databases.
Responsible for their code, continuously striving to improve code quality and impact.
Identify new opportunities to utilise data science to develop current design methodologies as well as new areas of service, both within Atkins and external partners.
Work collaboratively with a range of experts in support of organisational objectives.
Liaise with other elements of Atkins SNC-Lavalin to leverage the expertise and experience across the business as well as lead the implementation of new propositions developed.
Explore opportunities to apply research evidence and innovative technology solutions within the context of our design process and methodology.
Skills & Experience:
Degree level qualification in Data Science, Computer Science, or similar field.
Masters level degree in Applied Data Analytics or similar would be preferable.
Broad knowledge of data science techniques, use cases and potential impact, as well as the tools and technologies.
Experience in applying data science and analysis in an applied research environment to meet commercial objectives.
Programming experience in languages such as; Python, SQL, R, VBA, apache spark,big query, Node.JS, or similar for the purpose of research, urban analytics, construction analytics or similar.
Demonstrable understanding of data ethics, data preparation and manipulation.
Familiar with technology, tools, project organisation and delivery related to the built environment and construction sector.
Behaviours:
Ability to work independently as well as part of team constituting a range of discipline specialists and delivery teams.
Quick learner providing the ability to adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Ability to drive analytical scope and methodology for projects, including shaping the models in reference to a commercial environment.
Demonstrable passion for staying one step ahead of the competition, testing and experimenting with new technologies and methodologies and encouraging immediate team to do so too.
The ability to use data to explore new opportunities for research in the built environment.
What we offer?

So, by default Atkins offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 ‘till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.

At Papercup we’re on a mission to make the world’s videos watchable in any language. We’ve invented a patented AI system that generates humanlike synthetic voices across languages, allowing people to watch video content in the language of their choice. Our translated and dubbed content has allowed the likes of Insider, Discovery, Sky News, and Canva to reach over 300 million people globally in just the last year. Having just completed a $20 million Series A round, we're on the hunt for top people to join our ambitious mission.
We’re backed by some of the industry’s heaviest hitters - venture funds like Octopus Ventures, world-renowned angel investors including Des Traynor (co-founder of Intercom) and John Collison (co-founder of Stripe), as well as global media groups like Sky and Guardian Media Group.
We are driven, curious and passionate - our company culture is imperative to us and we set a high bar for those who join the team. We're also fun to be around (at least that's what people tell us).
The Role
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Papercup, you will be part of a great team pushing the boundaries of neural text-to-speech and speech-to-speech translation systems. You will generate and present ideas to improve our production systems and/or research ideas that could result in publications at ML or speech processing conferences.
You will own and push forward your projects during the whole research cycle, writing code implementation, running experiments, evaluating results, drawing conclusions. These will lead to prototypes and demos showcasing the capabilities of the proposed systems.
You will also contribute to maturing our research prototypes into fully-fledged production models as well as deploying them in our cloud infrastructure.
On the side, you will take part in our team-wide reading groups and present your work in team-wide and company-wide sessions or on our engineering blog.
What we are looking for from you:
Experience developing machine learning models using PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience contributing to research projects that have (or could have) led to publications at academic conferences
Either professional work experience plus Masters degree in machine learning or speech processing, or;
Equivalent experience working on ML or speech processing in industry

Nice to have:
Experience working with ASR and/or TTS systems
Experience developing with NLP systems and models for new domains and tasks
Good knowledge of audio and signal processing fundamentals
Familiarity with at least one cloud platform (AWS preferred), kubernetes, CI-CD
Why us:
We really care about our people - culture matters deeply to us and we are committed to building a company that people are proud to work for.
Competitive salary
Monthly wellness benefit
Remote working options (2-3 days)
Unlimited holidays
Personal learning budget

In a world where Data will be critical for BCG's success, BCG has founded a new cross-functional Agile team, the Global Data Tribe, to create first-class, foundational, enterprise-wide Data capabilities and products to enable better decision-making, generate new insights, attain operational excellence, and minimize firm risk across all BCG functions and teams
The Global Data Tribe is looking for a Data Science Manager, AI CoE to drive the ideation, development, and implementations of data science & AI driven use cases across BCG business functions with specific high focus on People & HR business function. The individual will work with data tribe leadership to drive AI/ML adoption in BCG to drive value and help in shaping up this newly formed AI Center of Excellence as part of Global Data Tribe. Individual will work closely with functional areas stakeholders to end to end drive identification, development, implementation, and maintenance of variety of data science use cases across BCG globally with razor sharp focus to realize value from data science & AI.
The ideal candidates will have a customer-centric mindset and enjoy working with cross-functional teams to design and deliver exceptional data science solutions. They will have 6+ years of experience in providing analytics solutions to solve variety of real-life business problems and have delivered significant impact to organizations using ML & AI. They should have strong hands on data science technical capabilities coupled with very good communication skills & business thinking with proven experience in stakeholder engagement and coaching & leading people.

Design and build analytics methodologies, solutions, and products to deliver value to BCG

Own approach design, choice of tools & techniques, execution & deployment of solution, solution monitoring and regular enhancements

Mentor & coach data scientists, senior data scientists, data engineers and other junior team members on need basis for a project
